stem: A 60-year-old painter reports progressive night pain and weakness with shoulder abduction. On exam, passive range is full, but active abduction beyond 90Â° is painful and weak. Drop-arm test is positive. Which tendon is most likely torn?
rationale_correct: A full-thickness supraspinatus tear causes painful arc, night pain, and drop-arm sign due to loss of initial abduction strength.

rationale_distractors.B: Infraspinatus tears mainly impair external rotation rather than abduction.
rationale_distractors.C: Subscapularis injury affects internal rotation strength.
rationale_distractors.D: Teres minor assists external rotation, not the drop-arm mechanism.
rationale_distractors.E: Long head biceps tendinopathy causes anterior shoulder pain but preserves drop-arm testing.
